meanings.definition: A leader or ruler, especially of a fascist or totalitarian regime.
meanings.sent1: The duce of the country made all the decisions.
meanings.sent2: The duce was known for his strict rule over the nation.
meanings.sent3: The duce's favorite color was red, so everything in the palace was painted that color.
meanings.sent4: The duce's power was as strong as a lion's roar.
meanings.sent5: The duce's presence commanded respect from all who saw him.

meanings.sent1: He will duce the group through the forest to safety.
meanings.sent2: She duces the team with confidence and determination.
meanings.sent3: The GPS device decided to duce the driver down a dead-end street.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition always duces her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: The stars in the night sky duce travelers on their journey.

meanings.sent1: Please duce the guests to the dining room for dinner.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of freshly baked cookies will duce anyone to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The enticing smell of popcorn duces moviegoers to the concession stand.
meanings.sent4: The sound of laughter duces a sense of joy to the room.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the music duces memories of happy times.
